subject: The New IDI Platform has Launched!
body:
The new IDI Platform is live! Check here for details on what you can expect so you can get started.

New IDI Platform has Launched!
We are excited to announce the completed launch of the new IDI Platform! You will receive an email inviting you to claim your IDI Platform account. If you do not receive that email, please let us know.
Your respondents are also able to claim their IDI accounts. Please visit our Help Center for information on how to complete that process.

subject: REMINDER: IDI Assessment Website Migration Starts Today
body:
With the new IDI Platform coming, the current IDI Assessment Website will be offline for migration.

IDI Assessment Website Migration Starts Today
 
Reminder:  IDI Qualified Administrators (QAs) will receive an email to claim your IDI QA account. Please use the email address associated with your IDI account to log into the new IDI Platform on 
Monday, February 17, 2025
. 
 
The current IDI Assessment Website will be unavailable starting today,
 
Wednesday, February 12, 2025 at approximately 3:00pm EST
, as we migrate to the new IDI Platform.
This means that all functions related to using the IDI (completing the IDI, ordering, generating IDI Reports, etc.) will 
not
 be available from Wednesday, February 12th until the new IDI Platform launches 
Monday, February 17, 2025
.
Please be sure to notify respondents if they are attempting to complete the IDI during this time. Once the migration has finished, you will be able to send account activation emails to your respondents with active Assessments so they can complete the IDI in the new Platform.
 
Some resources to help you prepare for the new IDI Platform are available in your account’s QA Resources page under 
New IDI Platform Resources.
You can find the previous emails sent here:
Announcement & Overview of Features
Original Launch Date & Migration Details
February 17th Launch Date 
All QA resources will move to the IDI Help Center once the new Platform launches. To access all QA-specific resources and articles, you will need to sign into the IDI Help Center (powered by Zendesk), which you can do by clicking the button below. Once signed in, you can track the articles you view and see the status of any support inquiries.
If you have emailed us before, you may already have an account. Signing up will let you know if you need to create an account or simply change your password. 
Sign Up for the IDI Help Center
Your login credentials for the IDI Help Center are 
separate
 from the new IDI Platform. 
Register for Upcoming Platform Events
All upcoming Q&A sessions are listed in Eventbrite.
Click below for details on all upcoming IDI Platform events.
Register
 
Questions?
Please reach out to us: 
support@idiinventory.com
View email in browser

You are receiving this email because you are listed within the IDI, LLC database as an IDI Qualified Administrator or are attending an upcoming IDI Qualifying Seminar. These are only meant for important updates, so please do not unsubscribe. 
Want to change how you receive these emails?
You can 
update your preferences
 or 
unsubscribe

IDI Assessment Website Migration Starts Soon
The current IDI Assessment Website will be unavailable starting next
 
Wednesday, February 12, 2025
, as we migrate to the new IDI Platform.
This means that all functions related to using the IDI (completing the IDI, ordering, generating IDI Reports, etc.) will 
not
 be available from Wednesday, February 12th until the new IDI Platform launches 
Monday, February 17, 2025
.
Please be sure to notify respondents if they are attempting to complete the IDI during this time. Once the migration has finished, you will be able to send account activation emails to your respondents with active Assessments so they can complete the IDI in the new Platform.
 
Some resources to help you prepare for the new IDI Platform are available in your account’s QA Resources page under 
New IDI Platform Resources.
You can find the previous emails sent here:
Announcement & Overview of Features
Original Launch Date & Migration Details
February 17th Launch Date 
All QA resources will move to the IDI Help Center once the newe Platform launches. To access all QA-specific resources and articles, you will need to sign into the IDI Help Center (powered by Zendesk), which you can do by click at the button below. Once signed in, you can track the articles you view and see the status of any support inquiries.
If you have emailed us before, you may already have an account. Signing up will let you know if you need to create an account or simply change your password.

separate
 from the new IDI Platform.

IDI Platform Launches February 17th
We are excited to announce the new IDI Platform will be launching on 
Monday, February 17, 2025
.
The current IDI Assessment Website will be 
unavailable
 starting 
Wednesday, February 12, 2025
. During the migration period, from February 12th-16th, you will not be able to access your IDI account or data. In addition, respondents will not be able to access the IDI Assessment during that time.
Your IDI data will be migrated to the new Platform and available in your account. If you would like any IDI results in the current report format, you should generate and download those reports no later than 
Tuesday, February 11, 2025
. After the launch, you will be able to generate and download IDI data in the new report format. You can see an example of the new IDI Profile Reports and Intercultural Development Plans (IDP) in your current QA Account under 
QA Resources - New IDI Platform Resources
.
 
Some resources to help you prepare for the new IDI Platform are available in your account’s QA Resources page under 
New IDI Platform Resources.
You can find the previous emails sent here:
Announcement & Overview of Features
Original Launch Date & Migration Details
Register for Upcoming Platform Events
All upcoming Q&A sessions are listed in Eventbrite.
Click below for details on all upcoming IDI Platform events.
Register
 
Questions?
Please reach out to us: 
support@idiinventory.com

subject: IDI Platform Launch Moved to January
body:
The new IDI Platform's launch has been delayed.
 
IDI Platform Releasing January
Due to an unforeseen delay in the last few days of final testing, we are forced to push back the launch of the IDI Platform to early January. An exact date will be announced soon. It is incredibly important to us that the new IDI Platform launches smoothly and can be a positive experience for all QAs. We sincerely appreciate your patience and understanding with this update.
The current IDI Assessment Website will continue to operate as normal, allowing you to proceed with your IDI projects without interruption.
 
Today, we are adding more resources in your QA Resources account under 
New IDI Platform Resources
 to help you prepare.
Register for Upcoming Platform Events
All upcoming Q&A sessions are listed in Eventbrite.
Click below for details on all upcoming IDI Platform events.
Register
 
Questions?
Please reach out to us:

subject: Your IDI Profile and Plan
body:
Hello Timothy,
 
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session on December 10th with Chuck Adams. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 11:00am CST. I sent a calendar invite with the Zoom link (copied below). Please let me know if you have any questions. 
Zoom Link:  
https://languageandculture.zoom.us/my/chuckadams
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.  
  
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.  
  
In preparation for your debrief
 
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:   
  
1.      When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?  
2.      What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures? 
3.      What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?   
 
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you!
 
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: IDI Platform Launch Delayed
body:
The new IDI Platform's launch has been delayed.
 
IDI Platform Launch Delayed
Due to an unforeseen delay in the development process, we have decided to postpone the launch of the IDI Platform. We are dedicated to delivering a complete platform that enhances the experience for you and your respondents. We anticipate the Platform will launch before the end of 2024 and will provide a new timeline as soon as we have more information.
In the meantime, the current IDI Assessment Website will continue to function as it has been, allowing you to proceed with your IDI projects without interruption. We understand that this delay may impact your planning, and we sincerely appreciate your understanding and patience during this time.

subject: Upcoming Webinar Cancelled
body:
The upcoming IDI Platform Preview Webinar (October 29, 2024) has been cancelled.
 
IDI Platform Preview Webinar Cancelled
Due to ongoing development, we are cancelling next week’s IDI Platform Preview Webinar. We will instead release short videos dedicated to showing key processes in the new IDI Platform. These short videos will cover the most common processes a QA completes in their IDI account, including ordering, viewing IDI Reports, and creating Report Groups of multiple respondents.
The videos will be released next week and announced via email. Additionally, they will be available on the QA Resources page.
We will keep our IDI Platform Q&A sessions as currently scheduled so we can answer any questions you have before and after launch.
We understand that this change may disrupt your schedule, and we apologize for any inconvenience. However, we believe that these focused videos will provide a more effective and efficient way to learn about the new IDI Platform. We appreciate your understanding and patience as we continue to enhance the QA experience!

subject: Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
body:
Hello Timothy,
LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in an individual debrief to discuss your individual results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete.
Please note that your individual profile results will be confidential to you - unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else. There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth.
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:                   
1) Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your profile.
2) To complete the assessment, please login at: 
https://idi5.idiassessment.com/
.  You will need between 20 – 30 minutes for the multiple-choice section.
3) Your unique username and password are below: (
case sensitive)
Username:
 2355-LCWComp127
 
Password:
 C7EZXRQG
 
4)It is important that you read the directions of the survey carefully. Your results will be confidential.    
5) In places where you are asked to consider “my culture” or “our culture,” think about your 
own
 culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to.
6) Once you have completed and submitted your assessment, please contact us at 
idi@lcwmail.com
 to schedule a time convenient for you to review your results.
Thank you,
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: ICYMI: IDI Platform Launches Nov 11 🚀
body:
Get ready for the new IDI Platform.
 
New IDI Platform Launches Nov. 11
The new IDI Platform will be launching on Monday, November 11th! The current IDI Assessment Website will be unavailable starting November 7th as we migrate to the Platform.
In our last email, we presented some of the new features the new IDI Platform will offer.
Listed below is more information to help you prepare. Also, details about upcoming Webinars dedicated to the new IDI Platform are at the bottom of the email, including a link to register.
Unused Assessment Expiration
In the new IDI Platform, unused Assessments will expire after two (2) years. They can still be re-assigned to a new respondent after purchase within that two-year timeframe.
Unused “Legacy” Assessments (IDI Login Codes from the current system that have not been submitted) will start their two-year expiration window at Launch. These will expire in November of 2026.
What will migrate to the Platform?
All submitted IDI data in active accounts
Any active (unsubmitted) IDI Login Codes and Prepaid Credits ordered since May 28, 2019 (the launch of the current IDI Assessment Website, “v5”)
The respondent of any unsubmitted IDI Login Code created after 
October 11, 2024
 which has an assigned email address will automatically receive an email to create their respondent account and complete the IDI when the Platform launches.
Click the button below for more details about what will and will not be migrated to the new IDI Platform.
Learn More
What will not migrate?
Any active IDI Login Code ordered before May 28, 2019 will 
not
 be migrated to the new IDI Platform. These are not compatible with the Platform’s infrastructure.
Submitted IDI data in archived accounts will also not migrate, regardless of order date. If you are receiving this and have an IDI account, then your account is active.
The current version of IDI Reports (Profile Reports and IDPs) will no longer be available in the Platform. If you need to access the current version of those Reports, you will need to do so before 
November 7, 2024
.
Customized question data will also not be migrating and has to be exported from the current IDI Assessment Website if that information is needed. Once migration begins, that information will be fully deleted from the IDI databases and cannot be recovered.
Exporting Customized Question Data
Respondents will not be grouped together in the new IDI Platform after the migration. Instead, to create an IDI Group Profile Report or organize your respondents into specific groups, you will need to create a new Report Group and add each respondent (individually or in bulk) to that Report Group (or multiple Report Groups, as needed). Once completed, you will be able to generate an IDI Group Profile Report for that particular group in the Platform.
The IDI Individual Profile Review (formerly the “ODP”)
Any unused Student Online IDI Debriefs in the current IDI Assessment Website will be migrated to the Platform and available as the new, updated IDI Individual Profile Review for Students. In the new IDI Platform, IDI Individual Profile Reviews can only be purchased as part of an order for IDI Student Assessments. However, should you have any Online IDI Debriefs that were ordered as a separate purchase in the current IDI Assessment Website, these will be available as IDI Individual Profile Reviews in the new Platform. You will be able to assign those to Student IDI Assessments for up to two (2) years after launch. Any completed Online IDI Debriefs connected to the existing IDI Assessment Website will no longer be available.
Learn More
What next?
Later this month, we will be offering two Webinars to give you a first look at the new Platform and guide you through the new IDI Reports. These Webinars will be recorded and made available to all QAs if you are not able to attend live.
Updated IDI Reports
October 22 | 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM ET
This Webinar will guide you through changes to the IDI Individual Profile Report, Intercultural Development Plan (IDP), and IDI Group Profile Report.
IDI Platform Preview
October 28 | 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM ET
We will present the new IDI Platform and demonstrate some of the processes and changes from the current IDI Assessment Website.
We will also be offering follow-up Q&A sessions to answer your questions around how the changes will affect your IDI work. These will be added in the coming days.
Click below for details on all upcoming IDI Platform events.
Register
Questions?
Please reach out to us: 
support@idiinventory.com
Let’s get social
Follow us on social media to keep in touch.

subject: Introducing the New IDI Platform: Coming Soon
body:
The new IDI Platform is coming this November!
 
Coming Soon:
New IDI Platform
We are thrilled to announce that we will be launching the brand new IDI Platform this November. This new Platform provides streamlined experiences and exciting new features.
The new Platform will replace the current IDI Assessment Website (sometimes referred to as “v5”) and will be the hub for individuals to access the Intercultural Development Inventory and IDI accounts.
We will be providing more details on the Platform’s capabilities via email in the coming weeks leading up to the Launch date. However, we want to share an overview of the new features and changes with you here:
IDI Assessment Updates
Demographic questions in the IDI have been expanded. As always, the responses to these questions will not impact IDI results.
Learn More
The Intercultural Development Inventory will be available in American Sign Language (ASL). We have partnered with Gallaudet University to create videos that can be accessed in the IDI assessment.
Learn More
Simplified Chinese is being added for respondents completing the IDI.
Learn More
To ensure a seamless respondent experience, custom questions will not be available in the new Platform.
Learn More
Updated IDI Reports
IDI Reports have been restructured and updated to maximize effectiveness with respondents and for QAs. At Launch, any existing respondent data can be used to generate these updated IDI Reports.
Learn More
All IDI Reports (including the Intercultural Development Plan) will be available in eight (8) total languages, with more languages to be added in the future.
Learn More
New Respondent Experience
Respondents will have their own accounts to easily track any IDI-related activity in one place.
Learn More
The IDI Profile Report Review for Students (formerly the ODP) is updated and will be completed within the  respondent account.
Learn More
Updated Pricing
At Launch, new pricing will be in effect for both the IDI Qualifying Seminar and IDI assessments.
Learn More
What next?
We will provide more details on other new features in the coming weeks. Starting in October and through the Platform’s launch, we will be offering Webinars to go over the changes to Reports and the Platform itself. There will also be live Q&A sessions available as a follow-up to the Webinars (which will be recorded).
Additionally, there will be a few days ahead of the Launch of the IDI Platform in November when the existing IDI Assessment Website will be unavailable while data is migrated and the new Platform is brought online.
Your IDI Data
You will 
not
 lose access to the respondents’ IDI results from your existing account. All submitted IDI results will be migrated into the new IDI Platform and will be accessible at Launch in the new Platform’s format.
Let’s get social
Follow us on social media to keep in touch.

subject: Your IDI Profile and Report
body:
Hello Peggy,
 
Attached is your IDI Profile (results) for reference during your IDI debrief session TODAY, 8/6/24, with Chuck Adams. By accepting your profile, you are confirming your commitment to attend the debrief session, which is an integral part of the assessment. As a reminder, your debrief starts at 2:00pm PST. 
  
During the debrief, which will take no more than an hour, you will learn not only how to correctly interpret your results, but also have the opportunity to discover what concrete things you can do in your role and day to day to develop even further around intercultural competence.  
  
Also attached is your Intercultural Development Plan (IDP). The primary focus of your debrief will be your profile, however, the IDP is a self-guided learning document that is based on your results and provides some suggestions, activities, and reflection questions around how to move towards a more intercultural mindset. We suggest that you review it after your debrief session.  
  
In preparation for your debrief
 
Reflecting on the following questions in advance of your call will greatly enhance and focus your experience:   
  
1.      When you took the assessment you were asked to think about “your culture”. What cultural group/s do you belong to, that you feel have shaped who you are?  
2.      What has been challenging and what has been rewarding for you when interacting and working with people of different backgrounds/different cultures? 
3.      What are key goals you and/or your team have, in which cultural differences need to be successfully navigated?   
 
Thank you, and we look forward to speaking with you!
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Fw: Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
body:
Hi Peggy. Please see Daniel's login credentials in the email below. 
Thank you,
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com
 
From:
 IDI Coaching @ LCW
Sent:
 Tuesday, July 23, 2024 1:53 PM
To:
 djoyce@linklogistics.com <djoyce@linklogistics.com>
Subject:
 Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
 
 
Hello Daniel,
LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in a group debrief session to discuss your group’s results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to complete it. You are scheduled to attend a Group debrief 
on July 25th.
 
Please note that your individual assessment results will be confidential. Your group's aggregate results will also be confidential within the group – unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else. There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth.
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:                   
1) Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your profile.
2) To complete the assessment, please login at: 
https://idi5.idiassessment.com/
.  You will need between 20 – 30 minutes for the multiple-choice section.
3) Your unique username and password are below: (
case sensitive)
Username:
 2355-LinkLogistics21
 
Password:
 54S88H57
 
4)It is important that you read the directions of the survey carefully. Your results will be confidential.    
5) In places where you are asked to consider “my culture” or “our culture,” think about your 
own
 culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to.
 
Thank you,
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

subject: Your Invitation to the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI)
body:
Hello Daniel,
LCW would like to invite you to take the Intercultural Development Inventory® (IDI®) assessment and participate in a group debrief session to discuss your group’s results. The IDI® is valid, reliable, and quantifies subjective diversity, inclusion, and cross-cultural ‘experience‘.  The assessment takes about 20-30 minutes to complete, so please set aside some time to complete it. You are scheduled to attend a Group debrief 
on July 25th.
 
Please note that your individual assessment results will be confidential. Your group's aggregate results will also be confidential within the group – unless you share them voluntarily with anyone else. There is no ‘right’ or ‘wrong’ score on the IDI®, and your results will not be used in any way other than to support your individual growth.
Completing the IDI Assessment Survey:                   
1) Please read the attached document “IDI Pre-Read”, which provides a brief description of the 50-question IDI instrument and how best to apply the results of your profile.
2) To complete the assessment, please login at: 
https://idi5.idiassessment.com/
.  You will need between 20 – 30 minutes for the multiple-choice section.
3) Your unique username and password are below: (
case sensitive)
Username:
 2355-LinkLogistics21
 
Password:
 54S88H57
 
4)It is important that you read the directions of the survey carefully. Your results will be confidential.    
5) In places where you are asked to consider “my culture” or “our culture,” think about your 
own
 culture, even if you do not currently find yourself living within that culture.  Though many individuals view their culture in terms of race, ethnicity, or nationality, do not feel compelled to limit your definition of your culture to these categories.  Your culture is defined by the community/group that you feel most connected to.
 
Thank you,
Kaitlin Nonweiler 
(she/her/hers)
IDI Administrator  
Email: 
k.nonweiler@lcwmail.com

All the best,
 
 
Patricia M Coleman 
(She-Elle-Ella)
Sr Consultant  
LCW
